TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SKSurface extends SkiaSharp.SKObject

Docs.summary: Represents the backend/results of drawing to a canvas

remarks.para: The surface represents the backend/results of drawing to a canvas. For raster drawing, the surface will be pixels, but (for example) when drawing into a PDF or canvas, the surface stores the recorded commands.
The surface always has non-zero dimensions. If there is a request for a new surface, and either of the requested dimensions are zero, then will be returned.
Once you create a surface with one of its methods, you can draw into the canvas returned by the property. Once the drawing is complete, you can retrieve an by calling the method.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKCanvas Canvas { get; }
.property instance class SkiaSharp.SKCanvas Canvas

Docs.summary: Gets the canvas for this surface which can be used for drawing into it.

Docs.param: The graphics context.
The description of the existing texture.
Docs.summary: Wraps a pre-existing backend 3D API texture as a surface.
Docs.returns: Returns the new surface if it could be created and the configuration is supported, otherwise .
Docs.remarks: The flag must be set on for this to succeed. The texture must remain valid for the lifetime of the surface.
